{{cpp/iterator/basic_const_iterator/title|operator*}}
{{cpp/iterator/basic_const_iterator/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++23|
constexpr std::iter_const_reference_t&lt;Iter&gt; operator*() const;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++23|
constexpr const auto* operator-&gt;() const
    requires std::is_lvalue_reference_v&lt;std::iter_reference_t&lt;Iterator&gt;&gt; &amp;&amp;
        std::same_as&lt;std::remove_cvref_t&lt;std::iter_reference_t&lt;Iterator&gt;&gt;,
                     value_type&gt;;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns a reference or pointer to the const version of the current element.

@1@ Returns {{c|static_cast&lt;std::iter_const_reference_t&lt;Iter&gt;&gt;(*base())}}.

@2@ If {{tt|Iter}} models {{lconcept|contiguous_iterator}}, returns {{c|std::to_address(base())}}; otherwise, returns {{c|std::addressof(*base())}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
@1@ Reference-to-const that refers to the current element. The result may be a prvalue (e.g. if {{tt|*base()}} is a prvalue).
@2@ Pointer-to-const that points to the current element.
